context: Window XP/Vista? Would a PC game with a Windows XP symbol still work on a PC Windows Vista computer. Thanks
response: I originally had a problem running some XP games in Vista.  I finally found the answer on an Electronic Arts website.  If having problems:1) find the .exe file in the game directory using Windows explorer2)right click it and click properties3)Click the Compatibility tab4) check the box run as compatible with windows XP/service pack 2

context: Does this include the Deep Fritz multiprocessor engine on it as well?
response: No. This version does not support mutiprocessors. I believe the one that does, is called Deep Fritz 13.

context: which wii has gamecube controller connections
response: Most Wii's have Gamecube ports on top, under a plastic door. Only the last 2 editions, the Mini and the Family edition(the one designed to lay flat) don't have them. Google for photos of theses two if needed...

context: Can you configure the buttons to specific keys? I want to program buttons for shortcut commands like CTRL+Z, for example.
response: This can be accomplished with programs such as Xpadder, AutoHotKey, or EventGhost. You can do this with most any controller, though.

response: Install the Moga Universal Driver from the Google playstore and you can play pretty much any Android game that supports a game controller.  It can be a bit tricky mapping the keys but it's hardly rocket science.

response: you can only transfer your "avatar" character to use on other files, but you need to "recruit" him by paying a considerable ammount of gold. Besides that, no, you need to start every difficulty from scratch.thats part of the experience though if you ask me.

context: WILL THESE WORK WITH PS3?
response: I can't say for certain they will, but I did a quick search for "Bluetooth compatibility PS3" and the resulting Wikipedia page (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Bluetooth_headsets_compatible_with_PlayStation_3) provides a long list of Bluetooth devices known to be compatible. Since the RaveTouch headset follows the same BT spec, it stands to reason that it will work.

response: I have to wear glasses all the time too. I have no issues with these headsets with my glasses.

response: Yes, you can turn them off. Even the lowest brightness setting is too bright for me so I figured out a way to turn them off, but you have to use the software that comes with the mouse.

context: Has anyone used the 710 Gamepad on a windows 8.1 system?
response: Yes I have. and it need a little of work. You must download the XBOX 360 controller driver, then install the logitech software. You must do it in that order. Also you may have to switch thru USB ports untill u find on that detect it. see my review for more info.

context: I have Xbox Gold. My kids have accounts on the Xbox but never played live. Is it possible for my family members to play XBL since I have gold?
response: Each family members need to have Xbox Gold in order to play online. Since you have it, only you can play XBL. Also make sure the Xbox Gold time in your account is not expired.
